meanings.definition: To pile up in a heap.
meanings.sent1: I will upheap the toys in the corner.
meanings.sent2: She likes to upheap her clothes on the chair.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to upheap all the nuts in one spot.
meanings.sent4: The students upheap their books on the desk before leaving.
meanings.sent5: Please upheap the leaves neatly in the garden.

meanings.definition: A pile or mass of something.
meanings.sent1: The upheap of laundry in the basket is huge.
meanings.sent2: He found an upheap of rocks at the bottom of the hill.
meanings.sent3: The upheap of papers on the desk toppled over.
meanings.sent4: The upheap of snow blocked the driveway.
meanings.sent5: The upheap of books in the library towered high.
